title: United Kingdom Business Investment
description:
Private Investment in the United Kingdom decreased to -0.50 percent in the third quarter of 2022 from 3.70 percent in the second quarter of 2022. Private Investment in the United Kingdom averaged 0.90 percent from 1967 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 51.50 percent in the first quarter of 1997 and a record low of -20.80 percent in the second quarter of 2020. In the UK, business investment is net investment by private and public corporations. These include investments in transport, information and communication technology (ICT) equipment, other machinery and equipment, cultivated assets, intellectual property products (IPP, which includes investment in software, research and development, artistic originals and mineral exploration), and buildings and other structures. It does not include investment by central or local government, investment in dwellings, or the costs associated with the transfer of non-produced assets (such as land).
. This page provides - United Kingdom Business Investment- actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: Office for National Statistics
